title: 104_hr3250
content: The National Discovery Trails Act of 1996 may be cited as the "National Discovery Trails Act." This Act includes amendments to the National Trails System Act. The National Discovery Trails Act of 1996, also known as the "National Discovery Trails Act," amends the National Trails System Act to establish National Discovery Trails as extended, continuous interstate trails for outdoor recreation and travel. These trails aim to connect various examples of America's trails and communities while conserving natural, cultural, and historic resources. The appropriate Secretary will administer these trails in cooperation with a nonprofit organization. The American Discovery Trail, a 6,000-mile trail from Delaware to California, is designated as a National Discovery Trail. It passes through several states and splits into two routes near Cincinnati. The American Discovery Trail is a 6,000-mile route from Delaware to California, passing through multiple states. It is administered by the Secretary of the Interior in cooperation with other agencies. The trail is exempt from certain sections and is described in a National Park Service feasibility study from June 1995. The American Discovery Trail, a 6,000-mile route from Delaware to California, is administered by the Secretary of the Interior. A comprehensive plan for the trail's protection, management, development, and use must be submitted by a nonprofit organization within three fiscal years of the enactment of legislation designating it as part of the system. The American Discovery Trail, a 6,000-mile route from Delaware to California, is overseen by the Secretary of the Interior. A nonprofit organization must submit a comprehensive plan for the trail's protection, management, development, and use to Congress. The plan must include specific objectives and practices for preserving natural, historical, and cultural resources, consulting with relevant stakeholders, and ensuring no conflicts with existing agency directives. The comprehensive plan for the American Discovery Trail must include preservation of cultural resources, model agreements for joint trail administration, a trail protection plan, development plans with costs, and a process for marking the trail in partnership with the Secretary of the Interior. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The National Trails System Act is amended to include "scenic, historic, and discovery" elements in various sections. The National Trails System Act is amended to include "scenic, historic, and discovery" elements in various sections by replacing "national historic" with "national historic, or national discovery" in multiple instances. The National Trails System Act is amended to include "scenic, historic, and discovery" elements by replacing "national historic" with "national historic, or national discovery" in various sections. The National Trails System Act is amended to include "scenic, historic, and discovery" elements by replacing "national historic" with "national historic, or national discovery" in specific sections.
